provis.src.processing package

Submodules

provis.src.processing.data_handler module

class provis.src.processing.data_handler.DataHandler(name)

Bases: object

The ‘brain’ of provis, when it comes to handling atomic positions.

This class loads information from a variety of files and creates meshes to be plotted. Upper level classes - eg. StickPoint - have their own AtomHandler objects that do all the work.

get_atom_mesh(atom_data, vw=0, probe=0, phi_res=10, theta_res=10)

Create a list of Shperes and colors representing each atom for plotting. Can later be added to a mesh for plotting.

Parameters

  • name – atom_data - Dictionary of atoms and their coordinates, by atom type

  • type – dict

  • name – vw, optional - When set to True Van-der-Waals atomic radii used instead of empirical radii; default false

  • type – bool

  • name – probe - size of probe (representing the solvent size) needed for surface calculation

  • type – int

  • name – phi_res - pyvista phi_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

  • name – theta_res - pyvista theta_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

Returns

list - List of pyvista Shperes representing each atom

Returns

list - List of colors for each atom

get_residue_info(res, chain, option)

Calculates information about specified residue from mol2 file

Parameters

  • name – res - Residue number of specified residue be looked at

  • type – str

  • name – chain - Chain number of corresponding to residue be looked at

  • name – option - choose what property of residue you want

  • type – str - com for Centre Of Mass, ch for charge

Returns

list - list of COM coords of given (exact) residue

provis.src.processing.file_converter module

class provis.src.processing.file_converter.FileConverter(name=None, dens=None, solv=0, bash=0)

Bases: object

Class to create and destroy necessary files required in other parts of code. It has a bunch of staticmethod functions to call the binaries and scripts to convert the files.

Best practice is to initialize a FileConverter in a given file before calling any function of provis and call the cleanup method after the last plotting function is called. This will keep your directories decluttered. However if you want to plot the same protein many times, then it is benificial to keep the temporary (data/tmp) files as if they exist provis will not recompute them.

static cleanup(delete_img: bool = False)

Deletes all files from data/tmp (and data/img) directories.

Parameters

  • name – delete_img - If True data/img directory also cleared, else just the data/tmp

  • type – bool

static msms(path, dens)

Run the msms binary for given filename.

It takes the {path}.xyzrn file as input and output is written to {path}_out_{dens} Binary path is read in from environment variable: MSMS_BIN. If environment variable does not exist binary will be looked up in provis/binaries/msms.

Parameters

  • name – path - Path to the/Name of the .xyzrn file to be converted.

  • type – str

  • name – dens - Density of triangulation

  • type – float

Returns

void - face and vert files

static pdb_to_mol2(path, outpath)

Run openbabel, to convert pdb to mol2

Parameters

  • name – path - Name of input (pdb) file (without extension)

  • type – str

  • name – outpath - Name of desired output file (without extension). It will add .mol2 to the given path.

  • type – str

static pdb_to_pqr(path, outpath, forcefield='swanson')

Run pdb2pqr, to convert pdb to pqr

Binary path is read in from environment variable: PDB2PQR_BIN. If environment variable does not exist binary will be looked up in binaries/pdb2pqr/pdb2pqr.

Parameters

  • name – path - Name of input (pdb) file (without extension)

  • type – str

  • name – outpath - Name of desired output file (without extension). It will add .pqr to the given path.

  • type – str

  • name – forcefield - Force field used for charge computation, by binary. Default: swanson. Options: amber, charmm, parse, tyl06, peoepb and swanson

  • type – str

static pdb_to_xyzrn(path, output)

Converts .pdb to .xyzrn file.

Parameters

  • name – path - Name of input (pdb) file (without extension)

  • type – str

  • name – output - Name of output (xyzrn) file (without extension)

Returns

void - xyzrn file

provis.src.processing.surface_feat module

https://github.com/bunnech/holoprot/blob/main/holoprot/feat/surface.py is the base for this file. Modifications were made.

Functions to compute features for a patch on the protein surface.

Some of these are borrowed from https://github.com/LPDI-EPFL/masif under the https://github.com/LPDI-EPFL/masif/blob/master/LICENSE license

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.assign_props_to_new_mesh(new_vertices, old_vertices: numpy.ndarray, old_props: numpy.ndarray, feature_interpolation: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray

Assign properties to vertices in modified mesh given the initial mesh. The assignment is carried using a KDTree data structure to query nearest points.

new_vertices: np.ndarray,

Vertices on the modified mesh

old_vertices: np.ndarray,

Vertices on the original mesh

old_props: np.ndarray,

Property values for each vertex on the original mesh

feature_interpolation: bool, (default True)

new_props: np.ndarray,

Property values for vertices on the modified mesh

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.compute_charges(vertices: numpy.ndarray, pdb_id: str, path: str) → numpy.ndarray

Computes electrostatics for the surface vertices. The function first calls the PDB2PQR executable to prepare the pdb file for electrostatics. Poisson- Boltzmann electrostatics are computed using APSB executable. Multivalue, provided within APSB suite is used to assign charges to each vertex. The charges are further normalized.

vertices: np.ndarray,

Surface vertex coordinates

pdb_id: str,

PDB ID of the protein

path: str,

Path of the pqr file in the form {path}.pqr

charges: np.ndarray,

Charge values for each vertex

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.compute_hbonds(vertices: numpy.ndarray, residues: List[Bio.PDB.Residue.Residue], names: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray

Compute H-bond (hydrogen-bond) induced charges at every vertex.

vertices: np.ndarray

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.compute_hydrophobicity(names: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray

Compute hydrophobicity value for all vertices on the surface. Each surface vertex has a mapping to the corresponding residue from the original protein. This is used to assign a hydrophobicity value to each vertex using the Kyte- Doolittle scale.

names: Identifier names for each vertex in the surface

hp: np.ndarray

Hydrophobicity values for each surface vertex

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.compute_shape_index(mesh) → numpy.ndarray

Computes shape index for the patches. Shape index characterizes the shape around a point on the surface, computed using the local curvature around each point. These values are derived using Trimesh’s available geometric processing functionality.

mesh: Mesh

Instance of the trimesh Trimesh type. The mesh is constructed by using information on vertices and faces.

si: np.ndarray,

Shape index for each vertex

provis.src.processing.surface_feat.compute_surface_features(surface: Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, List[str], Dict[str, str]], pdb_file: str, out_path: str, mesh=None, fix_mesh: bool = False, return_mesh: bool = False, pdb_id: Optional[str] = None) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray]

Computes all patch features.

surface: Surface,

Tuple of attributes characterizing the surface. These include vertices, faces, normals to each vertex, areas, fdue identifiers for vertices.

pdb_file: str,

PDB File containing the atomic coordinates

fix_mesh: bool (default False),

Whether to fix the mesh by collapsing nodes and edges

return_mesh: bool (default False),

Whether to return the mesh

pdb_id: str (default None)

PDB id of the associated protein

si: np.ndarray,

Shape index

hbonds: np.ndarray,

Hydrogen bond induced charges

hydrophob: np.ndarray,

Hydrophobicity of each surface vertex

charges: np.ndarray,

Electrostatics of each surface vertex

provis.src.processing.surface_handler module

class provis.src.processing.surface_handler.SurfaceHandler(name, dens=None)

Bases: object

The ‘brain’ of provis, when it comes to handling surface information.

This class loads information from a variety of files and creates meshes to be plotted. Upper level classes - eg. StickPoint - have their own AtomHandler objects that do all the work.

get_assignments()

Get assignments (coloring) for the mesh. File has to exist, no way to produce it with provis. Loads provis/data/tmp/{pdb_id}.pth and returns it.

Returns:

[type]: [description] #TODO

get_surface_features(mesh, feature)

Get the coloring corresponding to a specific feature.

Args:

mesh (Trimesh): The mesh feature (str): Name of feature we are interested in. Options: hydrophob, shape, charge

Raises:

NotImplementedError: If unkown feature specified error is raised

Returns:

[type]: [description] # TODO

native_mesh()

Returns a mesh without the need for the MSMS binary.

Returns:

pyvista.PolyData: The mesh

return_mesh_and_color(feature='', patch=False, simple=False)

Return the mesh and coloring ready for plotting.

Args:

feature (str, optional): Name of feature, same as in get_surface_features. Options: hydrophob, shape, charge. Defaults to “”. patch (bool, optional): Set coloring of mesh manually. If set to True get_assignments() will be called. Defaults to False. simple (bool, optional): If set to True only mesh is returned without coloring. Used for surface plotting. Defaults to False.

Returns:

Trimesh: The mesh - always returned #TODO: Coloring map for mesh corresponding to the specified feature
